issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: Stability: After long running test (-n 10 x 4) no longer able to run instances due to lack of free network addresses

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description:
Instances that previously ran on a Eucalyptus 3.2.1 cloud no longer can be ran.  Instances go from "PENDING" to "TERMINATED" state.  This can be seen in the CLC logs below for instance i-28C344F:

{code}

fields.summary: Cloud unable to launch instances; Walrus left "view" of CLC which caused NCs not be be able to download manifest file
fields.environment:
Layout:

* clean install - Eucalyptus 3.2.1
* SC - NetApp
* Single CLC, no HA.
* Separate walrus, no HA  
* Two AZ's, one cc/sc each, no HA

comments.body: Instances did run at one point across all NCs using the same images.  Now  Fedora 17 and RHEL images no longer will run.

After reviewing the issue, Walrus left the "view" of the CLC (e.g. Hosts.entryRemoved() was seen in the logs of the CLC IP address).  This caused the NCs not to be able to download the manifest file to confirm the images already cached on the NCs - thus the instances that were just launched on those NCs would stay in _pending_ state, and eventually timeout.  

Can we get any explanation as to why Walrus would mysteriously leave the "view" of the CLC?
Need to check if this is fixed in 3.2.2 (thanks Chuck!)

[~decker], Graziano mentioned you knew of the commit that fixed this issue for 3.2.2.  Can you comment and add any information on this issue?  The main thing here is that we want to confirm that this is fixed in 3.2.2.
[~chuck] has mentioned we believe this is fixed, but need [~decker] to comment on the specific commit.  [~decker], can you comment?

From another ticket:

We got some references from Chris Grzegorczyk in particular EUCA-5133, EUCA-4175, EUCA-4194, and EUCA-4354. Of all the one references I think EUCA-5133 seems more relevant, although it seems to fix the effect and not the cause. Waiting got Chris Grzegorczyk to confirm that we don't have anymore bugs related to the host view.
We got pointer to EUCA-5133, EUCA-4175, EUCA-4194, EUCA-4354: linking it at least while we investigate if it is indeed related.
[~graziano], just verified with [~decker] that there are no more bugs related to this issue and it should be resolved in 3.2.2
This issue is believed to have been resolved by [~decker] as part of other issues.
Relates to the issue of java components being pruned from the host view set.

[~chuck] I believe the relevant ticket (and so tagged commits) are for EUCA-6479 (already linked), also EUCA-4952 and EUCA-6198 (added links).

[~hspencer] Looking back at the logs there are a number which were not tagged properly by me :(  I've indicated the relevant commits below. 

*Importantly*, EUCA-6479 was supported by a contrived reproduction test (read:  test creates normal-abnormal conditions at a much higher rate than normal).  Prior to the fixes that went into 3.3.0 this test failed *around 25%* of the time (1000 samples; over 10 trails of 100 executions each).  After the fixes it fails *less than 1%* (0.8% over; same test method).  There is still a lingering issue, *but*:
# In general now, it is extremely unlikely to hit the bug, even when only executing the faulty code path.
# In reality, it is extremely unlikely, because, afaict, it happens during registration time which happens once per the lifetime of a service component (and can be checked for then).
# It has a benign and trivial work around: {{euca-modify-service -s STOP YOUR_SERVICE; euca-modify-service -s ENABLE YOUR_SERVICE}}



{code}
commit 8ea3582e713bf61d0305628475e1aac234601475
Author: chris grzegorczyk <grze@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Sat Jun 8 01:28:30 2013 -0700

    Include DISABLED among the states whose transitions are serialized; related to EUCA-6479

 .../java/com/eucalyptus/component/Topology.java    |    2 +-
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+), 1 deletion(-)
commit 6984c988faacd8a5227172c8060bec8caeb6f160
Author: chris grzegorczyk <grze@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 5 18:53:42 2013 -0700

    Remove special Topology behaviour during bootstrap which leads to local vs. remote state race
